decks.notes: This aggressive Death And Taxes deck utilizes a combination of disruptive cards like Thoughtseize and Fatal Push to control the board while deploying efficient threats like Phelia, Exuberant Shepherd and Orcish Bowmasters to pressure the opponent. The deck also includes flicker effects such as Ephemerate and Flickerwisp to generate value and protect key creatures. Teferi, Time Raveler provides additional disruption and the deck has a strong mana base with fetch lands and dual lands to support its color requirements. Overall, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while applying pressure to secure victory.

The deck is centered around fast and aggressive gameplay using Boros-colored creatures and spells to overwhelm the opponent. It focuses on utilizing cards that provide direct damage, buffs, and creature removal to control the board and maintain pressure on the opponent. By utilizing a mix of efficient creatures and versatile spells, the deck aims to quickly establish a threatening board presence while disrupting the opponent's game plan. The inclusion of powerful creatures like Ajani, Nacatl Pariah and Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer, along with spells like Goblin Bombardment and Seasoned Pyromancer, allows the deck to apply constant pressure and close out games swiftly.

The deck focuses on aggressive plays with a mix of creatures and spells to quickly overwhelm opponents. It utilizes cards like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer, Seasoned Pyromancer, and Guide of Souls to maintain board presence and apply pressure. Support cards like Goblin Bombardment and Ajani, Nacatl Pariah provide additional removal and damage options. The inclusion of Blood Moon and Static Prison helps disrupt opponent's strategies, while cards like Elegant Parlor and Fable of the Mirror-Breaker offer card advantage and flexibility. Overall, the deck aims to win quickly through efficient creature beats and impactful spells.

The deck focuses on ramping up mana quickly using cards like Utopia Sprawl and Eldrazi Temple to cast powerful Eldrazi creatures like Emrakul, the Promised End and World Breaker. It also includes control elements like Malevolent Rumble and Kozilek's Command to disrupt the opponent's game plan. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with big threats and disruptive spells while also controlling the board and the game tempo. The addition of cards like Talisman of Impulse and Formidable Speaker helps ensure the deck's mana base remains consistent and allows for quick ramping.

The main concept of this deck is to aggressively play low-cost creatures and spells to quickly overwhelm the opponent. The deck focuses on utilizing cards like Ajani, Nacatl Pariah and Guide of Souls to boost the power of your creatures, while also including cards like Goblin Bombardment and Galvanic Discharge for extra damage and removal. Blood Moon and Ranger-Captain of Eos are included for disruption and control. The mana base is designed to support a fast-paced, aggressive playstyle, with cards like Flooded Strand and Arid Mesa helping to fix your mana and keep the pressure on the opponent.

This Dimir Control deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's game plan through counterspells, removal spells, and card advantage. By utilizing cards like Counterspell, Fatal Push, and Sheoldred's Edict, the deck aims to control the board and prevent the opponent from executing their strategy. Consult the Star Charts and Wan Shi Tong, Librarian provide card advantage, while cards like Spell Snare and Spell Pierce help in stopping key spells from resolving. The deck is designed to outvalue the opponent and establish dominance in the late game through its control elements.

The deck focuses on quickly cycling through cards to fill the graveyard and then casting Living End to bring all creatures back onto the battlefield, potentially overwhelming the opponent with a large board presence. It includes cards like Street Wraith and Endurance to help fill the graveyard, while also including control elements like Force of Negation to protect the combo. The deck aims to win through a powerful combo turn, utilizing the Living End spell to swing the game heavily in its favor.

The deck focuses on generating mana quickly with cards like Ruby Medallion and Pyretic Ritual, then casting spells like Ral, Monsoon Mage and Grapeshot to deal damage to the opponent. It also utilizes cards like Past in Flames to reuse spells from the graveyard, and Artist's Talent to draw additional cards. The deck aims to create a storm of spells and abilities to overwhelm the opponent and win the game in a single explosive turn. It also includes cards like Wish and Strike It Rich to search for key combo pieces and accelerate the deck's game plan.

This Grixis Control deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's game plan by using a combination of efficient counterspells, hand disruption, and removal spells. The deck also leverages card advantage through card draw and manipulation, allowing the player to maintain control of the game and outvalue the opponent. The inclusion of powerful threats like Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student and Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer gives the deck ways to close out the game once the opponent's resources have been depleted. Overall, the deck aims to control the game and win through incremental advantage.

This deck focuses on quickly deploying powerful artifacts and utilizing them to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive attacks. Emry, Lurker of the Loch helps recur key artifacts, while cards like Tormod's Crypt and Engineered Explosives disrupt opponents' strategies. Urza's Saga and Mox Opal provide mana acceleration, enabling explosive plays. The goal is to quickly assemble a board presence using efficient artifact creatures like Arcbound Ravager and Memnite, and then use them in combination with equipment like Lavaspur Boots and Shadowspear to close out the game swiftly.

A deck that focuses on aggressive creatures and disruptive spells to quickly control the board and put pressure on the opponent. This deck utilizes a combination of powerful creatures like Phelia and Phlage, along with removal spells like Solitude and Prismatic Ending, to disrupt the opponent's game plan and push for a fast victory. With cards like Ragavan providing card advantage and Teferi's Time Raveler preventing the opponent from casting spells at instant speed, this deck aims to outpace and outmaneuver the opponent in a fast-paced Modern 1 vs 1 format.

This deck focuses on utilizing the UrzaTron lands to quickly ramp up mana and play powerful colorless Eldrazi creatures like Thought-Knot Seer and Ulamog, the Ceaseless Hunger. Karn, the Great Creator helps lock down opponent's resources while Ugin, the Eye of the Storms and Ugin's Labyrinth provide additional control and removal options. The deck also includes hand disruption with Kozilek's Command and Glaring Fleshraker for added disruption. Overall, the key strategy of this deck is to establish mana dominance quickly and overpower opponents with large Eldrazi threats while controlling the board.

This UW Control deck focuses on controlling the opponent's board through counterspells and removal, while also utilizing card advantage and manipulation to stay ahead in the game. The key strategy is to disrupt the opponent's game plan while setting up powerful threats such as Teferi, Hero of Dominaria and Terminus to take control of the game. Additionally, the inclusion of Kaheera, the Orphanguard as a companion provides a powerful anthem effect for all creature spells in the deck, adding another layer of synergy to the control strategy.

The deck focuses on a fast and aggressive playstyle, utilizing creatures and spells to quickly overwhelm the opponent. The key strategy is to establish a strong board presence early on, using cards like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Guide of Souls to deal damage efficiently. Cards like Ajani, Nacatl Pariah and Ocelot Pride provide additional support and buffs to the creatures. The deck also includes some control elements with cards like Static Prison and Goblin Bombardment to disrupt the opponent's strategy. Overall, the deck aims to apply constant pressure and win the game through quick and decisive attacks.

This Jeskai Control deck focuses on utilizing powerful control spells and creatures to disrupt opponents' strategies, while also providing card advantage and versatility through cards like Teferi, Time Raveler and Eugene, Nimble Pilferer. The deck also includes various removal spells and counterspells to handle threats efficiently. Additionally, the deck features a mix of alternate win conditions and card draw effects to ensure consistency and resilience in longer matchups. Overall, the deck aims to control the game's tempo and outvalue opponents with a combination of disruption and card advantage.

This Boros Aggro deck focuses on aggressive creature attacks and burn spells to quickly overwhelm the opponent. It utilizes cards like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Guide of Souls to generate early pressure, supported by cards like Goblin Bombardment and Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury for direct damage. The deck also includes cards like Ajani, Nacatl Pariah and Voice of Victory for additional support and protection. The versatile land base and strategic spell choices ensure consistent aggression and flexibility in the deck's gameplay.
